intro: Stachys recta subsp. labiosa, commonly known as narrowleaf betony, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces spikes of blue to purple flowers from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
